node.title: Rain pummels east coast of Australia, swelling rivers, wiping out crops
node.alt: a happy man cradles his young son, who is wrapped in a towel with lots of floodwater in the background
node.description: Rain has continued to fall overnight, leaving towns and highways flooded but also bringing hope and joy to parts of far-west New South Wales.
node.content:
["Parts of the east coast are getting drenched, with flood warnings in Queensland, NSW, and Victoria.", "Close to 60mm fell overnight at Byron Bay, Coonamble and Gunnedah while Dubbo recorded 66mm and\u00a0Wagga Wagga received the highest total in NSW with 70mm of rain.", "Cessnock, Richmond, Bathurst, Tuggeranong, Cooma and\u00a0Coonabarabran all recorded nearly 50mm overnight.", "Flooding has caused several road closures across Sydney, with the worst-hit areas being in Sydney's north west around Richmond and Pitt Town.", "The Bureau of Meteorology recorded up to 49 millimetres of rainfall in the region in the past 24 hours.", "", "
Heavy rainfall has caused renewed flooding across Pitt Town in Sydney's north-west
", "Aerial vision from over Pitt Town and Windsor show water spilling onto pathways and flooded fields.", "Macquarie and Bell Streets in South Windsor\u00a0and McClymonts Road in Maraylya remain closed in both directions.", "Oxford Falls Road at Oxford Falls and Berkshire Park at St Marys Road and Stony Creek Road are also closed.", "Hawkesbury River in Sydney's north west and Nepean River in Sydney's west remain on flood watch.", "In Queensland, more than 100mm was recorded in Bundaberg, around 80mm fell at Gladstone and Palmerville while\u00a070mm fell at Cooktown, and 60mm on the Gold Coast.", "Bowen, Hervey Bay and\u00a0Nambour recorded close to 50mm.", "A rain station at Combienbar in East Gippsland, Victoria\u00a0recorded that state's highest total, with nearly 55mm falling overnight.", "", "
The Kamilaroi Highway, near Boggabri\u00a0is swallowed by floodwaters.(Supplied:\u00a0Andrew Prince)
", "
Outback rain\u00a0welcomed
", "Many in far-west New South Wales have celebrated some of the best rain\u00a0the region has seen in years.", "At Packsaddle Station, 175km north of Broken Hill, Trudy\u00a0Atkins and Ben Lindsay recorded 39mm overnight.", "And the kids have been thoroughly entertained by the large puddles that have appeared around the homestead.", "In NSW corner country, 17mm fell at Theldarpa Station, and 7.5mm at Pimpara Kale Station.", "", "
It's all fun and games after nearly 40mm of rain fell at Packsaddle Station, 175km north of Broken Hill.(Supplied: Trudy Atkins)
", "These are some of the best rainfalls the region has seen in decades, and graziers said they have been perfectly timed.", "The rains have closed the Barrier Highway, with South Australian police urging travellers to take extra care on the roads, and avoid floodwaters.", "", "
The rain\u00a0has\u00a0been a welcome sight at Packsaddle Station, where Ben Lindsay and Trudy Atkins live.(Supplied: Trudy Atkins)
", "
Grain concerns
", "Heavy rains have delayed harvest in parts of NSW and Victoria, which could see crops either downgraded from food-grade to animal feed or destroyed if they get too wet.", "In the NSW Western Plains region,\u00a0Scott Empringham from Nevertire felt thankful he was able to get his crop harvested prior to the deluge.", "\"I was fortunate to get the crop off before this hit of rain,\" Mr Empringham said.", "\"We pulled the truck into the shed last Friday afternoon before the rains started, so,\u00a0touch wood,\u00a0I've had a good run.\"", "But\u00a0others have not been as lucky. Near Moree, where 38\u201345mm fell overnight, grain grower Oscar Pearse said the harvest was on hold.", "Mr Pearse faced\u00a0yield losses of between 10 to 100 per cent on his crops and estimated\u00a0the downgraded quality could see income reduced by up to 70 per cent this season.", "For the crop that had\u00a0been harvested, he was spending more than $80,000 on temporary storage.", "\"This was supposed to be a recovery year after a major two-and-a-half-year drought,\" he said.", "\"We've now, during the 2021 harvest period, received more than double the total rainfall we did for the whole 2019 growing season.\"", "
Cherries hit
", "Early varieties of cherries have been seriously affected by moisture in some key growing regions, including northern Victoria and southern NSW.", "\"There are some regions that have tried to pick as much as they can, but the amount they've been able to pack has been a lot lower than they would have liked,\" Young grower Tom Eastlake said.", "\"And there are other areas where growers have just walked away from early varieties and are hoping the others will be better.\"", "Mr\u00a0Eastlake said the weekend brought a nervous wait\u00a0with forecasts of more rain.", "
Swollen rivers
", "Water continues to rush into storages across the Murray-Darling Basin, as Hume Dam approaches 100 per cent capacity.", "The Murray-Darling Basin Authority increased its daily release of water from the dam from 21.5Gl\u00a0to 30Gl\u00a0per day on Thursday.", "\"Current releases are not expected to exceed the minor flood level in the Murray River at Albury for now, however higher releases over the next 24 to 48 hours may result in flows above minor flood level,\" it said in a statement.", "The Murray, Murrumbidgee, Lachlan, Gwydir, Namoi, and Macquarie Rivers all have flood warnings in place.", "", "
Flooding has isolated the community of Wee Waa and impacted other towns like Narrabri and Gunnedah.
", "
Stranded and on alert
", "The small community of Wee Waa in northern New South Wales has become its own island, after being isolated from flooding overnight.", "The community has been isolated by road from all directions since yesterday evening after the Namoi River reached a height of 7.07 metres, 37 centimetres above the predicted river height.", "It may be cut off for more than 10 days.", "Up to nine homes at Cassilis and one in Murrurundi in New South Wales' Upper Hunter have been inundated by floodwaters, while the New England Highway between Scone and Aberdeen sits waterlogged.", "A major flood warning has been issued for Kingdon Ponds in the Hunter River catchment at Scone, with the local council advising that the river has broken its banks.", "", "
Boot and Kettle Creek flowing over Rubyvale Road in central Queensland on Friday morning.(Supplied: Amanda Gittens)
", "Several emergency alerts for flash flooding were issued at The Gemfields in Queensland's Central Highlands between 8pm and midnight last night.", "In the past 48 hours, an average of 150 millimetres fell throughout the catchment, but falls of up to 270mm were recorded near Theresa Creek."]
